caption:
This photograph presents a landscape view of a residential area sprawled across hilly terrain. In the foreground, a cluster of single-story homes with flat or slightly sloping roofs are visible, marking a typical suburban neighborhood. The homes predominantly display earthy tones like beige, and the rooftops are various shades of brown and gray. These houses are surrounded by lush greenery, with trees interspersed between the homes, adding a touch of nature to the residential setting.

Moving towards the middle ground, the landscape continues to feature more houses, though these appear to be larger and possibly multi-storied, hinting at a mix of residential styles. There are also patches of undeveloped land and areas covered with thicker vegetation, possibly parks or undeveloped plots, which break the continuity of the built environment and provide green spaces.

In the background, the hilly terrain becomes more pronounced, and the density of the buildings seems to decrease. The area features more greenery, with clusters of trees and open spaces, suggesting a less urbanized part of the region. The hills might also be home to some larger, possibly more affluent residences, given their elevated and secluded positions.

Overall, the atmosphere of the photograph is serene and well-established, illustrating a typical suburban landscape that balances residential development with natural elements. The sky is clear, suggesting fair weather, which contributes to the clarity and vividness of the scene.
title: Development near mulholland drive in the santa monica mountains near Malibu, California, which is located on the western edge of Los Angeles.  The mountains nearby contain the last semi-Wilderness in Los Angeles county.  Some 84 percent of the state's residents live within 30 miles of the coast, and this concentration has resulted in increased land use pressure.
